alert.note: Alert for Hampden; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 6:38AM EDT until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. For the Connecticut River...including Holyoke, Middle Haddam, Hartford, Thompsonville, Montague, Holyoke Dam, Northampton... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Deerfield River...including West Deerfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Northampton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 117.0 feet, Flooding impacts a large portion of the Oxbow in Northampton. Flooding associated with back water from the Connecticut will continue to impact Hatfield. Flooding will continue to worsen along the Mill River in Hatfield while flooding begins to affect parts of Cronin Hill. Some streets may be closed and some local evacuations may be required. Flooding will also become more widespread throughout Northampton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 113.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 112.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM EDT Tuesday was 113.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 116.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 112.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 117.2 feet on 08/30/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 315 PM EDT.
